abstract: SAP, the German software giant, said Wednesday that it it had agreed to buy database software maker Sybase for $5.25 billion as it seeks to keep pace with Oracle.
snippet: SAP, the German software giant, said Wednesday that it it had agreed to buy database software maker Sybase for $5.25 billion as it seeks to keep pace with Oracle.
lead_paragraph: 5:49 p.m. | Updated Ashlee Vance has more in The New York Times.

headline.main: SAP to Buy Sybase for $5.25 Billion
